metadata.title: CVE-2023-52730 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mmc:sdio: fix possible resource leaks in some error paths If sdio_add_func() orsdio_init_func() fails, sdio_remove_func() can not release the resources,because the sdio function is not presented in these two cases, it won'tcall of_node_put() or put_device(). To fix these leaks, makesdio_func_present() only control whether device_del() needs to be called ornot, then always call of_node_put() and put_device(). In error case insdio_init_func(), the reference of 'card->dev' is not get, to avoidredundant put in sdio_free_func_cis(), move the get_device() tosdio_alloc_func() and put_device() to sdio_release_func(), it can keep theget/put function be balanced. Without this patch, while doing fault injecttest, it can get the following leak reports, after this fix, the leak isgone. unreferenced object 0xffff888112514000 (size 2048): comm"kworker/3:2", pid 65, jiffies 4294741614 (age 124.774s) hex dump (first 32bytes): 00 e0 6f 12 81 88 ff ff 60 58 8d 06 81 88 ff ff ..o.....`X...... 1040 51 12 81 88 ff ff 10 40 51 12 81 88 ff ff .@Q......@Q..... backtrace:[<000000009e5931da>] kmalloc_trace+0x21/0x110 [<000000002f839ccb>]mmc_alloc_card+0x38/0xb0 [mmc_core] [<0000000004adcbf6>]mmc_sdio_init_card+0xde/0x170 [mmc_core] [<000000007538fea0>]mmc_attach_sdio+0xcb/0x1b0 [mmc_core] [<00000000d4fdeba7>]mmc_rescan+0x54a/0x640 [mmc_core] unreferenced object 0xffff888112511000(size 2048): comm "kworker/3:2", pid 65, jiffies 4294741623 (age 124.766s)hex dump (first 32 bytes): 00 40 51 12 81 88 ff ff e0 58 8d 06 81 88 ff ff.@Q......X...... 10 10 51 12 81 88 ff ff 10 10 51 12 81 88 ff ff..Q.......Q..... backtrace: [<000000009e5931da>] kmalloc_trace+0x21/0x110[<00000000fcbe706c>] sdio_alloc_func+0x35/0x100 [mmc_core][<00000000c68f4b50>] mmc_attach_sdio.cold.18+0xb1/0x395 [mmc_core][<00000000d4fdeba7>] mmc_rescan+0x54a/0x640 [mmc_core]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222
linux-image-4.15.0-211-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-211.222
linux-image-4.15.0-211-lowlatency - 4.15.0-211.222
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-generic - 4.15.0-211.222
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-211-lowlatency - 4.15.0-211.222
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-149-generic - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-149-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-149-lowlatency - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-149-generic - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-149-lowlatency - 5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1140-kvm - 4.15.0-1140.145
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-aws - 4.15.0-1156.169
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-aws - 5.4.0-1103.111~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1165-azure - 4.15.0-1165.180
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1108-azure - 5.4.0-1108.114~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-gcp - 4.15.0-1150.166
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1105-gcp - 5.4.0-1105.114~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1049-ibm - 5.4.0-1049.54~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-211.222').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-149.166~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1140.145').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.169').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
linux-aws-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.4').
linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1103.111~18.04.1').

linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1165.180').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1108.114~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
